alert.note: Alert for Charles City; Essex; Gloucester; James City; King William; King and Queen; Lancaster; Middlesex; New Kent; Northumberland; Richmond; Westmoreland (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued January 09 at 7:28PM EST until January 09 at 8:15PM EST by NWS Wakefield
info.description: The National Weather Service in Wakefield has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Northwestern Gloucester County in eastern Virginia... King and Queen County in east central Virginia... Middlesex County in eastern Virginia... Northwestern Northumberland County in eastern Virginia... Central Charles City County in east central Virginia... Richmond County in east central Virginia... New Kent County in east central Virginia... Westmoreland County in east central Virginia... Southeastern King William County in east central Virginia... Northwestern James City County in southeastern Virginia... Southeastern Essex County in east central Virginia... Lancaster County in eastern Virginia... * Until 815 PM EST. * At 728 PM EST, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Tappahannock to near New Kent to Adkins Store, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to trees and powerlines. * Severe thunderstorms will be near... New Kent, Charles City, Warsaw, King And Queen Court House, Dunnsville, Ruthville, and Center Cross around 735 PM EST. West Point, Haynesville, Holdcroft, Sharps, and Little Plymouth around 740 PM EST. Jamaica, Farnham, and Barhamsville around 745 PM EST. Toano, Church View, Morattico, and Shacklefords around 750 PM EST. Robley and Norge around 755 PM EST. Other locations impacted by these severe thunderstorms include Eltham, Currioman Landing, Threeway, Croaker, Wayside, Belle Isle State Park, Rose Garden, Lyells, Crouch, and Westmoreland. TORNADO...POSSIBLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: Remain alert for a possible tornado! Tornadoes can develop quickly from severe thunderstorms. If you spot a tornado go at once into the basement or small central room in a sturdy structure. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Please report severe weather by calling 757-899-2415, posting to the NWS Wakefield Facebook page, or using Twitter @NWSWAKEFIELDVA. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 900 PM EST for southeastern and east central Virginia.
